{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the relevant documents, the sulcular epithelium is described as nonkeratinized and relatively permeable. It is also mentioned that the sulcular epithelium is attached to the junctional epithelium and meets the epithelium of the oral cavity at the height of the free gingival margin. Considering this information, it can be inferred that the sulcular epithelium allows substances to pass through it. Therefore, both bacterial products from the gingiva and fluids from the gingiva can seep into the sulcus. Hence, the correct answer is C. Both of the above.", "answer_choice": "C"}
